alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Northern Brevard; Inland Volusia; Mainland Northern Brevard; Northern Lake County; Orange; Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 28 at 5:50PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Seminole, east central Lake, northwestern Brevard, northwestern Orange and southeastern Volusia Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 550 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cassia to near Sanford to near New Smyrna Beach. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Deltona, Sanford, Apopka, Altamonte Springs and Oviedo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!
